speaker: A
text: I’m down bad in the market. Any words of wisdom?

speaker: B
text: Oh, totally. Let me tell you about my friend Steve. He treated dating like day trading.

speaker: A
text: This already sounds like a disaster…

speaker: B
text: Absolute train wreck. He’d buy high, sell low—meaning he’d only date people who were out of his league, panic the moment things got serious, and bail at the worst possible time. One time, he ghosted a girl right before her start up received a buyout offer. She’s probably a multi-millionaire now.

speaker: A
text: So he was bad at relationships and risk management?

speaker: B
text: Then one day, he decided to "HODL" for the first time. He met a girl, stuck with her through some tough times, even when it wasn’t looking great. And now? They’re engaged.

speaker: A
text: Okay, I see the message— HODL through the dips, believe in the long-term potential.

speaker: B
text: Nah, I was just saying don’t be like Steve. But if it helps your portfolio, go for it.
